oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gruss aus Metz Postcard from Major Bernard Edwin Ragland to his wife, Estella Finley Ragland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Maj. Bernard Edwin Ragland (1894-1963) served in the Dentist Corps and was a member of the Medical Detachment of the 155 Inf. Regt., 39th Div. during World War I. This German postcard, sent by Maj. Ragland to his wife, Estella Finley Ragland, reads "Greetings from Metz." Germany annexed Metz in 1871, and France regained control in 1918. The upper left picture on the postcard shows a statue of German Emperor Wilhelm I that Major Ragland reports the French knocked down upon entering Metz.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
